healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Asangathit Karmakar Gambhir Bimari Chikitsa Sahayata Yojana
objectives: Provide financial assistance for medical treatment of serious illnesses
Support unorganized workers with healthcare needs

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹50,000 for medical treatment of serious illnesses like kidney, cancer, sickle cell anemia, heart disease, AIDS, and paralysis

eligibility_criteria: Registered with the State Board for at least 90 days
Age between 18 and 60 years
Registered as a beneficiary of unorganized workers under Section 10 of the Act
Not availed benefits from similar government schemes

steps: Visit the official Chhattisgarh Labour Department website
Click 'Apply' under 'Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board'
For unregistered applicants: Select 'Asangathit Marmakaar Mandal', 'Asangathit Shramik Panjikaran', and 'Aavedan', then fill and submit the registration form
For registered applicants: Select 'Yojana', provide district name and registration number, select scheme, fill details, and submit

documents_required: Disease details by Vikas Khand Adhikari/Surgeon/Chief Medical Officer/Health Officer
Approximate expenses details by related Medical Officer

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Distress Relief Fund For The Differently Abled (Medical Treatment)
objectives: Provide financial assistance for medical treatment and surgery for disabled persons
Support those handicapped due to accidents
Cover purposes not addressed by existing schemes for the handicapped

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹5,000 per person per year for medical treatment, including surgery

eligibility_criteria: Resident of Kerala
Disabled or handicapped due to an accident
Annual income not exceeding ₹20,000 in rural areas or ₹22,375 in urban areas
Disabilities include: Blind, Deaf and Dumb, Orthopedically Handicapped, Mentally Challenged, or BPL with 40% or more disability

steps: Visit SUNEETHI-Online Service Application Portal for one-time registration
Fill in details like Name, Email ID, Mobile Number, and verify with OTP
Create profile with mandatory details
Login, update personal, contact, identity, and bank details
Select the scheme, fill the application form, and submit

documents_required: Aadhaar Card or Voter ID Card
Bank account details (copy of bank passbook)

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Atal Mission For Rejuvenation And Urban Transformation (AMRUT)
objectives: Ensure access to tap water and sewerage connections for every household
Increase city amenity value through greenery and open spaces
Reduce pollution by promoting public and non-motorized transport

components: Urban transport (ferry vessels, buses, footpaths, BRTS)

eligibility_criteria: Open scheme with no specific eligibility criteria
Covers 500 cities including those with population over one lakh, capital cities, heritage cities, and select others

steps: No individual application required
Projects executed by Urban Local Bodies (ULBs)
State Government may involve parastatal agencies via tripartite MoU
ULBs responsible for maintenance of created assets

objectives: Provide financial assistance for treatment of life-threatening diseases
Support treatment for injuries from natural or manmade disasters

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹3,00,000 for treatment of life-threatening diseases and accident-related injuries
benefits.disbursement: Direct bank transfer to beneficiary or hospital, with advance payment up to ₹3,00,000 to hospitals

eligibility_criteria: Resident of Assam
Family income less than ₹5,00,000 per annum
No age limit
Excludes government employees or pensioners and their families
Treatment in government or registered private hospitals

steps: Download application form from https://nhm.assam.gov.in/schemes/assam-arogya-nidhi
Submit completed form to NHM, Assam or Joint Director of Health Services
Expert Committee verifies and recommends eligible cases
Financial assistance provided via Direct Bank Transfer

documents_required: Attested income certificate by Revenue Circle Officer
Attested identity and address proof (Voter ID, Aadhaar, Driving License)
Medical documents certified by treating doctor/hospital

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Theka Shramik Evan Hamaal Shramik Baahy Rogi Chikitsa Sahaayata Yojana
objectives: Provide financial assistance for medical treatment of unorganized workers
eligibility_criteria: Registered worker in any district of Chhattisgarh
Age between 18 and 60 years
Not availed benefits from similar state government schemes

steps: Visit the official Chhattisgarh Labour Department website
Click 'Apply' under 'Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board'
For unregistered applicants: Select 'Asangathit Marmakaar Mandal', 'Asangathit Shramik Panjikaran', and 'Aavedan', then fill and submit the registration form
For registered applicants: Select 'Yojana', provide district name and registration number, select scheme, fill details, and submit

documents_required: Disease details by Vikas Khand Adhikari/Surgeon/Chief Medical Officer/Health Officer

objectives: Promote sanitation through construction of household and community toilets
Improve solid waste management
Raise public awareness and capacity building

financial_support: ₹6,667 for toilet construction in specified states

eligibility_criteria: Households without access to individual toilets or with insanitary toilets
80% of urban households engaging in open defecation

steps: Create Applicant Login ID on IHHL portal using Name, Mobile Number, Email, Address, ID Type, ID Number
Enter geographical particulars (State, District, ULB Name, Ward No.)
Provide toilet owner’s particulars (Name, Gender, Father/Husband’s Name, Mobile No, Address, Toilet Status, Aadhaar, Bank Details, Photograph)
Submit application to generate IHHL Application Acknowledgement slip

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Grant of Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste Pregnant & Lactating Women
objectives: Support the well-being of Scheduled Caste pregnant and lactating mothers and their children

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹12,000 (₹2,000/month for three months pre-natal and three months post-natal, for up to two deliveries)

eligibility_criteria: Citizen of India
Resident of Puducherry for at least 3 years
Belong to Scheduled Caste
Female and pregnant
Apply between 6 months of pregnancy and within 3 months post-delivery
Annual income of applicant and spouse not exceeding ₹2,00,000

steps: Visit Adi Dravidar Welfare Department office for application form
Fill mandatory fields, attach self-attested documents
Submit to concerned authority
Obtain receipt/acknowledgment with submission details

documents_required: Medical Certificate from authorized health center

objectives: Provide cashless delivery services for BPL pregnant women
Address shortage of specialist doctors in rural areas through public-private partnerships

benefits.services: Free delivery services, checkups, and medicines in registered private hospitals
financial_incentive: ₹3,00,000 per 100 deliveries for private hospitals (with ₹30,000 advance)

eligibility_criteria: Resident of Karnataka
Belong to BPL family
Hospitals must have 10 inpatient beds, operation theater, delivery room, 24-hour specialist availability, and blood bank linkage

steps: Register with Junior Female Health Assistant of the area
Receive ANC card for identification
Avail benefits at registered hospitals
Contact head office at prs-hfw@karnataka.gov.in for queries

documents_required: ANC registration number indicating first or second delivery

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Nirmaan Shramik Mrtyu Evan Divyaang Sahaayata Yojana
objectives: Provide financial assistance to families of construction workers in case of death or disability

financial_assistance: ₹2,50,000 for permanent disability at work location

eligibility_criteria: Construction workers aged 18 to 60 years
Registered under Section 12 of the Building and Other Construction Workers Act, 1996
Excludes deaths due to suicide, substance abuse, crime, or riots
Not applicable for family member deaths
Not eligible if benefited under silicosis assistance scheme

steps: Visit Chhattisgarh Labour Department website
Click 'Apply' under Building and Other Construction Workers
Provide district and registration number, select scheme
Fill and submit online form with required documents
Note application number for tracking
Check status via 'Check the application status' option

documents_required: Death certificate or permanent disability certificate

objectives: Empower unorganized workers with financial assistance for maternity

financial_assistance: ₹4,200 in third month and ₹2,800 in eighth month of pregnancy for female employees
₹3,000 as paternity leave for male employees after child’s birth
benefits.limit: Benefits for up to two children

eligibility_criteria: Registered worker (male or female)
Benefits limited to two children

steps: Visit Chhattisgarh Labour Department website
Click 'Apply' under 'Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board'
For unregistered applicants: Select 'Asangathit Marmakaar Mandal', 'Asangathit Shramik Panjikaran', and 'Aavedan', then fill and submit registration form
For registered applicants: Select 'Yojana', provide district name and registration number, select scheme, fill details, and submit

objectives: Provide financial assistance for treatment of diseases in government hospitals

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹1,50,000 for treatment in government hospitals

eligibility_criteria: Possess a National Food Security Card
Resident of Delhi for the last 3 years with domicile proof
Treatment in government hospitals in Delhi

steps: Download application form from official website
Fill form with required details
Attach photocopies of documents, bring originals for verification
Submit undertaking for signature verification
Submit to Patient Welfare Cell, Directorate of Health Services, Karkardooma, Delhi

documents_required: Proof of continuous residence in Delhi for 3 years (National Food Security Card, Voter ID, Birth certificate for minors, Electoral roll extract, Aadhaar Card)
Original Estimate Certificate signed by Consultant/Medical Superintendent/CMO
Two attested photographs of the patient
Copy of National Food Security Card

objectives: Assist Overseas Indian nationals in distress situations
Support emergency evacuations and community welfare activities

assistance_types: Transportation of mortal remains or local cremation/burial
Boarding and lodging for distressed nationals
Air passage to India for stranded nationals
Legal assistance for minor crimes or false implications
Emergency medical care for accidents or serious conditions
Support for cultural programs, Indian language teaching, and student welfare activities

eligibility_criteria: Overseas Indian national in distress
Excludes Persons of Indian Origin and OCI Card Holders for individual financial assistance

steps: Apply through Indian Missions/Posts abroad
For compensation claims: Submit application as per nation-specific guidelines
Refer to sample forms from Embassy of India, Kuwait or Jeddah

documents_required: Original Passport of the deceased with photocopy
Police or medical reports as relevant

objectives: Conduct health check-ups for organized sector workers

benefits.health_checkup: Full medical check-up costing ₹1,950 per worker (25% or ₹487.50 paid by organization)

eligibility_criteria: Workers with Labour Welfare Fund paid regularly for the last one year
Male workers above 45 years, female workers above 35 years
Benefit provided once a year
Medical examination within 30 days of approval

steps: Visit Sanman Portal: https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in
Register under 'Citizen Login' with Aadhaar and Labour Welfare Fund Account Number
Login, select scheme, read instructions
Fill application form, upload documents
Submit and receive confirmation email with application number

objectives: Provide financial support during maternity for registered construction workers

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹6,000, limited to two times in beneficiary’s lifetime

eligibility_criteria: Resident of West Bengal
Registered building/construction worker for at least 1 year
Aged 18 to 60 years
Engaged in construction work for at least 90 days in a year
Pregnant female member or wife of male member

steps: Obtain Form-27 for registration from Assistant Labour Commissioners
Submit registration form with documents
For scheme: Obtain Form-XII, attach documents, and submit to Assistant Labour Commissioners
Pay ₹20 registration fee and ₹30 yearly subscription

objectives: Provide financial assistance for treatment of life-threatening disorders and diseases

financial_assistance: District Head Quarters Hospitals: Up to ₹30,000
CDMO with Collector approval: Up to ₹50,000

eligibility_criteria: Below poverty line or annual family income not exceeding ₹40,000 (rural) or ₹60,000 (urban)
BPL card, AAY card, or income certificate required
RSBY cardholders eligible
Unknown accident victims or referred patients from registered destitute homes/orphanages eligible
Inpatient treatment in government/empanelled private hospitals

steps: Submit prescribed application form with documents to Nodal Officer
For government hospitals: Committee approves up to ₹1,00,000; above requires further approval
For district hospitals: Committee approves up to ₹30,000; CDMO can approve up to ₹50,000
For private hospitals: Referral from government medical college/CDMO required, except in emergencies

documents_required: Annual family income certificate by Tahasildar

objectives: Promote menstrual hygiene among school girls
Reduce school dropout rates
Empower women through local production of sanitary products

services: Free sanitary napkins for girls in classes 6 to 12
Subsidized napkins for rural women at ₹6 for 6 napkins
Support for local production and employment

eligibility_criteria: Resident of Odisha
School girls from classes 6 to 12

steps: No application required
School girls receive sanitary napkins at school
Rural women contact ASHA workers or visit PHCs/community health centers

objectives: Provide financial assistance for treatment of silicosis for registered construction workers

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹1,50,000 for silicosis treatment after exhausting ₹50,000 from Bhagat Puran Singh Sehat Beema Yojna

eligibility_criteria: Resident of Punjab
Registered building/construction worker
Aged 18 to 60 years
Engaged in construction work for at least 90 days in a year
Monthly income ₹15,000 or below
Not a member of EPF/NPS/ESIC or other welfare funds
Not an income tax payer
Diagnosed with silicosis
Exhausted ₹50,000 health card benefit

steps: Register at Sewa Kendra or with Registering Officers/Labour Inspector
Pay ₹25 registration fee and ₹10 monthly contribution
Apply for scheme benefits at Sewa Kendra or with Registering Officers
Check application status online at https://pbocwwb.in

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Scheme to Provide Relief in Case of Death or Disability of Registered Building Workers
objectives: Provide financial relief for accidental death, permanent disability, or natural death of registered construction workers
eligibility_criteria: Nominee/dependent of deceased or disabled construction worker
Worker registered with Andhra Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

steps: Visit A.P. Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board office
Obtain and fill prescribed application form
Attach self-attested documents
Submit to Assistant Labour Officer/Assistant Commissioner of Labour
Obtain receipt/acknowledgment

documents_required: Aadhaar Card of worker and nominee
Death Certificate for natural or accidental death

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
objectives: Provide universal health coverage for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization
Cover 10.74 crore poor and vulnerable families

benefits.health_cover: ₹5,00,000 per family per year for listed conditions
services: Medicines, diagnostics, implants, accommodation, food services
benefits.features: No cap on family size or age, covers pre-existing diseases

eligibility_criteria: Rural: Families meeting at least one of six deprivation criteria or automatic inclusion criteria (destitute, manual scavengers, tribal groups, bonded labour)
Urban: 11 occupational categories (e.g., ragpicker, domestic worker, construction worker)
Exclusions: Owners of vehicles, mechanized farming equipment, Kisan cards, government employees, high-income earners, or those with refrigerators/landlines

steps: Visit hospital or Community Service Centre (CSC)
Arogya Mitra searches beneficiary list using name, location, ration card, mobile, or RSBY URN
Verify identity with Aadhaar or government ID and ration card
Upload scanned documents for individual and family identification
Submit records to trust/insurance company for approval
Receive e-card upon approval by State Health Agency

documents_required: Document proving family status (joint or nuclear)

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Rastriya Arogya Nidhi - Health Minister’s Cancer Patient Fund
objectives: Provide financial assistance to BPL patients for cancer treatment at Regional Cancer Centres

financial_assistance: Up to ₹15,00,000 for exceptional cases with Ministry approval

eligibility_criteria: Below poverty line
Suffering from cancer
Treatment at one of 27 Regional Cancer Centres
Excludes Central/State Govt./PSU employees
Excludes cases where free treatment is available

steps: Download prescribed application form
Complete form and get it signed by treating doctor and Medical Superintendent
Submit form with required documents to concerned government hospital

documents_required: Prescribed application form signed by treating doctor and Medical Superintendent
Income certificate by Block/Mandal Development Officer/Tehsildar/SDM

objectives: Provide financial aid for medical needs of registered construction workers
eligibility_criteria: Resident of Jammu & Kashmir
Registered building/construction worker
Aged 18 to 60 years
Engaged in construction work for at least 90 days in the last 12 months
Suffering from injury, disability, or chronic disease
Annual registration renewal

steps: Visit JKBOCWWB website for registration
Complete registration form, verify OTP, and receive Login ID/password
Login, select 'Construction Worker’s Registration', fill form, upload documents, pay fee
For scheme: Login, select 'Scheme Registration', choose scheme, fill details, submit
Track status online or via registered mobile number

healthcare_schemes.department: Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
objectives: Provide financial support to nominees/legal heirs of deceased registered workers
eligibility_criteria: Nominee/legal heir of deceased worker
Deceased worker registered with HPBOCWWB
Active membership at the time of death

steps: Visit HPBOCWWB website, click 'Apply for Benefits'
Enter beneficiary details and date of birth, search
Select scheme, fill details, upload documents
Submit application
Track status online or via registered mobile number

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Chief Minister’s Health Insurance Scheme - Nagaland
objectives: Provide cashless hospitalization for employees, pensioners, and general residents

health_cover: ₹20,00,000 per family per annum for CMHIS (EP) beneficiaries
₹5,00,000 per family per annum for CMHIS (GEN) beneficiaries
benefits.services: Covers surgical, medical, and limited daycare packages in empanelled hospitals

eligibility_criteria: Permanent and indigenous residents of Nagaland
CMHIS (EP): Government employees, pensioners, or dependents with valid documents
CMHIS (GEN): Indigenous Inhabitant or Permanent Resident not covered by AB PM-JAY

steps: Visit CMHIS Nagaland website
Register with required details
Submit application with documents to CSC or empanelled hospital
Verification by insurance provider
Approval/rejection based on eligibility

documents_required: Indigenous Inhabitant Certificate (IIC) or Permanent Residential Certificate (PRC) issued after 2016 (for CMHIS GEN)
Photo ID card, Engagement/Appointment Order, or Letter from controlling officer (for employees without PIMS)
PPO book pages, PIMS code, or dependency documents (for CMHIS EP)

objectives: Financially protect journalists from health-related monetary burdens

benefits.health_cover: Up to ₹3,00,000 for listed diseases as recommended by committee

eligibility_criteria: Permanent resident of Tripura
Accredited journalist by state government or PIB
Aged 21 to 65 years
Not covered under Ayushman Bharat or other Central/State health insurance schemes

steps: Apply to Director, Information and Cultural Affairs Department, Agartala
Verification by Sub-Divisional Magistrate and other agencies
Application reviewed by Tripura Journalist Health Insurance Scheme Recommendation Committee
Approval by State Government for enrollment

healthcare_schemes.scheme_name: Financial Incentives To Mothers Who Deliver A Girl Child (Mamta)
healthcare_schemes.department: Directorate of Women And Child Development
objectives: Improve female child sex ratio in the state

financial_incentive: ₹10,000 one-time payment at birth of a girl child
₹5,000 balance for those who received 1st installment under old scheme

eligibility_criteria: Mother who delivered a live girl child in a registered medical institution
Resident of Goa for at least 3 years or married to a Goa resident
Application within 45 days of delivery
No social/economic status restrictions

steps: Apply in prescribed format to Child Development Project Officer at ICDS Block Office
Submit within 45 days of delivery with required documents

documents_required: Certified/Self-Attested Birth Report/Certificate from Registered Institution
Proof of 3-year residency in Goa or marriage certificate with husband’s residential certificate
Pre-receipt in duplicate (Annexure-2 for new beneficiaries, Annexure-3 for 1st installment recipients)
